background: Paths must be established in a network of nodes where links have defined capacities and associated costs, ensuring data reach their intended destinations at specific rates.

parameters.definition: The number of links between nodes in the network.
The starting node for link ij
The ending node for link ij
The maximum capacity for link ij
The cost for transporting data through link ij
The number of data flow requirements.
The source node for data flow kl
The destination node for data flow kl
The rate of data flow for flow kl

constraints.description: The sum of data flows on each link cannot exceed its capacity
Each link's data flow must be non-negative
Every source node must have outgoing links with data flows summing to at least the required data rate for that source
constraints.code:
# Add constraints for data flow from source nodes
for k in range(NumFlowReqs):
    flow_from_source = gp.quicksum(Flow[ij,k] for ij in range(NumLinks) if StartNode[ij] == Source[k])
    model.addConstr(flow_from_source >= DataRate[k], name=f"flow_requirement_source_{k}")

constraints.description: The sum of data rates on all links to each destination node must be at least the required data rate for that destination
Flow conservation at intermediate nodes for each flow requirement

variables.definition: The amount of data flow kl that is flowing through link ij

objective.description: Minimize the total cost of data transmission across all links for all data flow requirements.
objective.code:
# Set objective
model.setObjective(gp.quicksum(Cost[ij] * Flow[ij, kl] for ij in range(NumLinks) for kl in range(NumFlowReqs)), gp.GRB.MINIMIZE)
